snippet: The U.S. and the European Union are expected to open talks early next year on a free-trade agreement that could help boost growth on both sides of the Atlantic. But will President Obama's opponents try to obstruct a deal in Congress?
abstract: The U.S. and the European Union are expected to open talks early next year on a free-trade agreement that could help boost growth on both sides of the Atlantic. But will President Obama's opponents try to obstruct a deal in Congress?

headline.main: Europe Eyes Trade Pact With Obama
